newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: PDVSA's Graf sees gradual fall in oil prices.
newsitem.headline: PDVSA's Graf sees gradual fall in oil prices.

text.p: The re-entry of Iraq into oil markets will not have a violent impact on oil prices which will weaken gradually over coming months, a top Venezuelan oil official said Friday.
"The entry of Iraq will obviously affect prices but not in a violent fashion," Claus Graf, vice-president of Petroleos de Venezuela (PDVSA), told a breakfast meeting with journalists.
The basket of Venezuela's crudes and products has averaged nearly $18 per barrel in 1996, well above forecasts of $13.50 per barrel at the start of the year.
"We think that the current situation is not permanent... There will be a gradual reduction to about $15 per barrel next year," Graf said.
The Venezuelan government has based its 1997 budget on an average oil price of $14 per barrel.
